minimal.essence: Ancient trading house spanning twelve systems. Wealth built on commerce, maintained by marriage and murder. Three heirs, two factions, one throne. The serpent eats its tail.
minimal.symbol: Green serpent coiled around golden scales
minimal.current_status: Succession crisis brewing. Lord Verdania's health failing. Factions maneuvering.

full.history: Founded during the Expansion Era, House Verdania rose on trade routes others thought unprofitable. Survived three empires, two purges, and countless rivals. The current generation may tear apart what centuries built.
full.values: Profit above all, but never at the cost of the House's name. Contracts are sacred. Debts are always collected. Family secrets stay family secrets.
full.operations: Trade fleets, banking interests, commodity exchanges. Fingers in shipping, insurance, and information. Nothing illegal - just gray.
full.structure: Feudal with corporate overlay. Main branch rules, lesser branches administer regions. Merchant Arm operates semi-independently for deniability.
full.territories: Core holdings in Verdania system. Trade posts across sector. Banking presence in most major ports.

arc.trajectory: The succession will be decided within the year. Blood is likely.

succession_status.current_lord: Lord Aldric Verdania - failing health, months to live
succession_status.heir_apparent: Lord Marcus Verdania - traditional choice, firstborn
succession_status.challenger: Lady Serena Verdania - reformist, popular with younger generation
succession_status.dark_horse: Prince-Consul Orlen - from cadet branch, officially neutral
succession_status.complications: No clear testament. Lord may die before naming successor. Legal challenges likely.
